alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 8:51PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Barry. * WHEN...Until 900 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 849 PM CST, The Department of Transportation reported flooding along the Flat Creek basin from previous heavy rainfall. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway C, Flat Creek at Highway Y, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145 and Flat Creek at Highway U. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Exeter, Washburn, Butterfield, Mcdowell, Jenkins, Madry, Pleasant Ridge, Wheelerville, Wayne and Roaring River State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
